lexUnit.name: consent.v

corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

lexUnit.definition: FN: to acquiesce to another person\'s plan or proposal

sentence.text: Is a defendant who fails even to consider that a woman might not be consenting still to be acquitted if he takes her consent for granted ?
We were in Glasgow last weekend , and were quite chuffed when Ewan consented to come out for a walk just with us two , as he clings to Joyce a bit at the moment .
But would Mr Moon consent to come alone ?
On the rare occasions when he consented to do interviews , he usually sat silent and still , staring stone-faced at baffled journalists .
He consented to give the address at the funeral of Angela Carter , the novelist .
The queen has graciously consented to open her London house to the public for two months every summer , and they want to sample royal glasnost before the offer expires , at the end of 1997 .
As you rightly say , the present border was drawn on a sectarian head count in such a way as to include a large area which has never consented to partition .
The clubs co-own the ground , but Mr Waddington said he understood that if one club consented to sell , the other had to buy them out or agree to sell .
Agrippa , although he objected at first , reluctantly consented to write out the warrants and disburse the necessary silver for our journeys .
They said if we did n't consent for him to claim for the two of us , they 'd summons me and him for aiding and abetting .
Democratic audiences had to consent to this approach .
It was held that the owner had not clothed the dealer with apparent authority since he had retained the ignition key and not consented to the dealer having possession of the registration document .
The House of Lords held in Lawrence that a person was guilty of theft even when the owner has consented to the taking of the property .
Whether or not Lovebite consented in our Dionysian excesses , Lord Lane had declared them illegal .
Even if she consents in fact , this has no effect in law and the offence is still committed .
And I would not for the world meddle with her plans , though I am proud that she has consented on the way to visit me for a while .
The firm can treat the customer as an ordinary business investor even if he does not consent in writing unless he says otherwise ; a one-way letter is sufficient .
Secondly , the student volunteers to become a nurse and therefore consents to being guided by those who know what is required .
An example is the case of Burrell v Harmer [ 1967 ] Crim LR 169 : boys of 12 and 13 could not consent to being tattooed .
` Yes , let's , " she consented cuttingly .
One may ask what one would have had to do had one consented .
In other words he concluded that , as to that , Miss T. had neither consented nor refused .
He demanded their young daughters too , and most parents consented .
The accused does not , for instance , need to have reasonable grounds for his belief that the owner would have consented , had he known of the circumstances .
Certainly , however , if the owners had known of the secret intention , they would not have consented .

In an effort to diffuse the tense relations between Iran and the IAEA and to preserve the sanctity of the nonproliferation regime , foreign ministers of Britain , France and Germany secured Iran 's consent to cooperation with the IAEA ahead of the 31 October deadline .
